intro: Pseudotectaria warburii, commonly known as the Warburton's spike moss, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Huperjaniaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are clustered in small, cone-like formations at the tips of the leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists studying the evolution of vascular plants.
